actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.
Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1578.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to exclude from the definition of an unrelated trade or business qualified convention and trade show activities carried out by an organization described in section 501(c)(3).

summary.text: (Reported to House from the Committee on Ways and Means with amendment, H. Rept. 95-1578) Amends the Internal Revenue Code to permit qualifying tax-exempt organizations, including charitable, religious, and educational organizations, to conduct conventions and trade show activities designed to educate individuals engaged in a particular industry about new products and services or new rules or regulations affecting such industry without subjecting such tax-exempt organization to the unrelated business tax.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to exclude from the definition of an unrelated trade or business qualified convention and trade show activities carried out by an organization described in section 501(c)(3).
